p: Regarding the colorimetric dosages of total carbohydrate and protein, the OFIEOH presented 250 mg of d-glucose equivalent/g dry extract (25%) and 2 mg of bovine albumin equivalent/g dry extract (0.2%), respectively. According to reference [ 5], the carbohydrate and protein contents found in cladodes in natura were from 3 to 7% and from 0.5 to 1%, respectively. As expected, the composition of the plant material may vary according to the edaphoclimatic conditions, cultivation method, the season of the year, the origin of collection, and age of the plant [ 23].
